attributes.action: Prevent the export abroad of Eric 'winkle' Browns medals.
attributes.additional_details:
Winkle Brown was a major part in pioneering air flight development, taking unflyable aircraft to the point of destruction and then upon landing advising how to cure the fault,always with 100%

Brown even flew the V1 and V2 rockets to evaluate them for the allies,This chap should have more of a memorial from the country than having his medals sold off.
attributes.background: Britain's greatest test pilot, he flew a record 487 types of aircraft, developed naval deck landing at sea, interrogated top nazis at Nuremberg, worked on the design of Britain's latest Aircraft carrier.

rejection.details:
The sale of these medals was the responsibility of Eric Brown's family. The medals have been bought by the Royal Navy Fleet Air Arm Museum:

http://www.fleetairarm.com/exhibition/Coming-Soon---The-medals-and-log-books-of-Captain-Eric-Winkle-Brown/8-53.aspx
